remarks: Obsolete as of 14-Mar-2020.  The image of a subgroup ` S ` of group ` G ` under a group homomorphism ` F ` on ` G ` is a group, and furthermore is Abelian if ` S ` is Abelian.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 25-Apr-2008.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
ghsubgoOLD.1 $e |- ( ph -> S e. ( SubGrpOp ` G ) ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.2 $e |- X = ran G $.
ghsubgoOLD.3 $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> Y ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.4 $e |- ( ph -> Y C_ A ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.5 $e |- ( ph -> O Fn ( A X. A ) ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> ( F ` ( x G y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) O ( F ` y ) ) ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.7 $e |- Z = ran S $.
ghsubgoOLD.8 $e |- W = ( F " Z ) $.
ghsubgoOLD.9 $e |- H = ( O |` ( W X. W ) ) $.
ghsubgolemOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( H e. GrpOp /\ ( S e. AbelOp -> H e. AbelOp ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d H x y $.
$d O x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d W x y $.
$d Z x y $.
$d ph x y $.
